The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its foliage consists of finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a soft, silvery pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
